com.incoming.pvnsdk

Class PushVideo

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.incoming.pvnsdk.PushVideo

  • public class PushVideo
extends java.lang.Object
    The main class used to configure the Push Video SDK. Add the following to onCreate() method of the host application's Android Application class or launch Activity: 
     
  // Optionally activate SDK logging
  LogIncoming.setDevBuild(true);
  PushVideo.initialize(getApplicationContext(), "API ENDPOINT", "PROJECT KEY");

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  PushVideo.ContentPresentationStrategy 

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int PRESENTATION_INTERSTITIAL
      Allow the application to control when the video is played (interstitial style).
      static int PRESENTATION_PRESENCE
      Display the videos when the user becomes present.
      static int PRESENTATION_PRESENCE_ALWAYS_PLAY
      Always play a video when the user becomes present (for testing)
      static int PRESENTATION_PVN
      Display the videos in a notification.

      • getVideoDescriptor

        @Nullable
public static UnifiedVideoDescriptor getVideoDescriptor(@Nullable
                                                                  android.os.Bundle extras)
        Utility method to extract a VideoDescriptor from a bundle.
        Parameters:
        extras - a bundle containing a serialized video object
        Returns:
        the video object, or null if the bundle is null or the bundle does not contain a video object.

        Returns:

      • isVideoComplateBroadcast

        public static boolean isVideoComplateBroadcast(android.content.Intent intent)
        Check if a broadcast intent refers to the completion of a video.
        Parameters:
        intent - a broadcast intent
        Returns:
        true if the intent action matches the video complete broadcast action

      • registerVideoCompleteReceiver

        public static void registerVideoCompleteReceiver(android.content.BroadcastReceiver receiver)
        Register for local broadcasts after each video has been viewed.
        Parameters:
        receiver - the broadcast receiver

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(@NonNull
                              android.content.Context context,
                              @NonNull
                              java.lang.String endPoint,
                              @NonNull
                              java.lang.String projectKey)
        Configure the Push Video SDK using the the PRESENTATION_PVN display method.
        Parameters:
        context - The application context. This must not be null.
        endPoint - the PVN API endpoint provided with the PVN configuration. This must not be null.
        projectKey - the project key provided with the PVN configuration. This must not be null.

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(@NonNull
                              android.content.Context context,
                              @NonNull
                              java.lang.String endPoint,
                              @NonNull
                              java.lang.String projectKey,
                              int contentPresentationStrategy)
        Configure the Push Video SDK.
        Parameters:
        context - The application context. This must not be null.
        endPoint - the PVN API endpoint provided with the PVN configuration. This must not be null.
        projectKey - the project key provided with the PVN configuration. This must not be null.
        contentPresentationStrategy - the method used to display videos

      • isGCMMessageForPushVideo

        public static boolean isGCMMessageForPushVideo(@Nullable
                                               android.os.Bundle extras)
        Helper method to check if a GCM message is intended for the Push Video SDK. Host applications that use GCM messages for other purposes should use this method to filter out messages that are not intended for the host application.
        Parameters:
        extras - the extras associated with the GCM message intent
        Returns:
        true if the GCM message was posted by the Push Video Service

      • configureAudienceSegmentationKeys

        public static void configureAudienceSegmentationKeys(@Nullable
                                                     java.util.Set<java.lang.String> segmentationKeys)
        Configure the keys used to filter content and perform segmentation based on user preferences.
        Parameters:
        segmentationKeys - the keys used to filter content based on user preferences. Passing null or and empty set will clear any segmentation targets that have been set before. The key values must be alphanumeric and not contain any spaces.

      • setLocationEnabled

        public static void setLocationEnabled(boolean locationAccessAllowed)
        Enable/disable the use of location for learning and analytics at runtime. The use of location also requires the Android coarse location permission to be granted. This method must be called after initialize(Context, String, String)
        Parameters:
        locationAccessAllowed - true if location information should be used for learning and analytics

      • isLocationEnabled

        public static boolean isLocationEnabled()
        Check if location information is being used for learning and analytics. This method must be called after initialize(Context, String, String)
        Returns:
        true if location information is being used for learning and analytics

      • isApiLevelSupported

        public static boolean isApiLevelSupported()
        The Push Video SDK will not be started for any API level less than this. Push Video SDK methods may be called on older platform but no action will be taken.
        Returns:
        the minimum Android API level supported by the Push Video SDK.

      • getDataAccessService

        @NonNull
public static DataAccessService getDataAccessService()

      • isInterstitialReady

        public static boolean isInterstitialReady()
        Check if there us a video available to play now. The timing algorithm is not used. This method will generate an error if the SDK has not been initialized to use the #PRESENTATION_INTERSTITIAL presentation strategy.
        Returns:
        true if there is a video available to play now

      • shouldPlayInterstitial

        public static boolean shouldPlayInterstitial()
        Check if the timing algorithm indicates whether now is a good time to play a video. If this method returns true then it should be followed by a call to presentInterstitial() to play the video. This method will generate an error if the SDK has not been initialized to use the #PRESENTATION_INTERSTITIAL presentation strategy.
        Returns:
        returns true if the timing algorithm has determined this is a good time to present a video to the user

      • presentInterstitial

        public static void presentInterstitial()
        Plays the next video as an interstitial. Does nothing if isInterstitialReady() returned false. This method will generate an error if the SDK has not been initialized to use the #PRESENTATION_INTERSTITIAL presentation strategy.
